perturbation.original_text: This agreement is made effective   Oct. 11, 1996 by and between PC QUOTE, INC. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ"), a Delaware Corporation with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 and AB Wately, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW") with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, NY  10011. This agreement shall apply to said ABW and all of its subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement is made effective   Oct. 11, 1996 by and between PC QUOTE, INC. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ"), a Delaware Corporation with its principal place of business at 300 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60605 and AB Wately, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "AB Watley" or "the Client") with its principal place of business at 33 West 17th Street, New York, NY  10011. This agreement shall apply to said ABW and all of its subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.explanation: The term "ABW" is also referred to as "AB Watley" or "the Client." This creates ambiguity about the roles and responsibilities, particularly later when the agreement refers to ABW, potentially impacting the interpretation of obligations and liabilities.

perturbation.original_text: PCQ agrees to allow ABW to co-brand the PCQ SOFTWARE in order to provide a value added service on ABW's World Wide Web site.  The co-branded SOFTWARE will be made available via ABW software housed at the ABW office listed in this Agreement.  The server will be accessed by all ABW subscribers in order to download the SOFTWARE and receive the HYPERFEED.
perturbation.changed_text: PCQ agrees to allow AB Watley to co-brand the PCQ SOFTWARE in order to provide a value added service on Client's World Wide Web site.  The co-branded SOFTWARE will be made available via the Client application hosted at the AB Watley location listed in this Agreement.  The server will be accessed by all AB Watley users in order to download the SOFTWARE and receive the HYPERFEED.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the entities are referred to in multiple ways: ABW, AB Watley and Client, all potentially referring to the same entity. The changes introduce confusion, especially when discussing ABW's responsibilities, as it is not clear whether 'Client' and 'AB Watley' refer to the same legal entity in all contexts.

perturbation.original_text: The ABW hereby acknowledges and agrees that the HYPERFEED provided under this Agreement contains market information obtained, selected and consolidated by PCQ under the authority of various agencies, including but not limited to, the New York Stock Exchange, American Stock Exchange, Pacific Stock Exchange, Midwest Stock Exchange, Chicago Board Options Exchange, the Options Price Reporting Authority, the Consolidated Tape Association, Chicago Board of Trade, Chicago Mercantile Exchange/International Monetary Market, Kansas City Board of Trade, Minneapolis Grain Exchange, Commodities Exchange Center, New York Futures Exchange, Mid-America Commodity Exchange, and Consolidated Canadian Group and that the ABW's use of the service for internal or external redistribution of date is authorized and regulated by said agencies.
perturbation.changed_text: The Client hereby acknowledges and agrees that the HYPERFEED provided under this Agreement contains market information obtained, selected and consolidated by PCQ under the authority of various agencies, including but not limited to, the New York Stock Exchange, American Stock Exchange, Pacific Stock Exchange, Midwest Stock Exchange, Chicago Board Options Exchange, the Options Price Reporting Authority, the Consolidated Tape Association, Chicago Board of Trade, Chicago Mercantile Exchange/International Monetary Market, Kansas City Board of Trade, Minneapolis Grain Exchange, Commodities Exchange Center, New York Futures Exchange, Mid-America Commodity Exchange, and Consolidated Canadian Group and that the AB Watley's use of the service for internal or external redistribution of date is authorized and regulated by said agencies.
perturbation.explanation: The use of 'the Client' in one instance and 'AB Watley's' in another introduces an inconsistency. It becomes unclear which legal entity is ultimately responsible for adherence to the agency regulations regarding the data redistribution, especially if 'the Client' is later defined differently within the agreement or its interpretation.
